alert.note: Alert for Butler; Cowley; Sedgwick; Sumner (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 09 at 2:57AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Cowley, southern Sedgwick, southern Butler and northern Sumner Counties through 330 AM CDT... At 256 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 5 miles northwest of Viola to 5 miles east of Mulvane to 6 miles northeast of Dexter. Movement was east to northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Wichita, Derby, Winfield, Andover, Haysville, Augusta, Wellington, Mulvane, Goddard, Rose Hill, Clearwater, Cheney, Douglass, Belle Plaine, Conway Springs, Oxford, Garden Plain, Udall, Downtown Wichita, and Eastborough. This includes the following highways... Interstate 135 between Mile Markers 0 and 7. Interstate 35 between Mile Markers 18 and 53. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
